<!-- ABOUT THE PROJECT -->

## About The Project

Cofund is an expense sharing application similar to Tricount. It allows users to create groups, add expenses, and see balances between members.

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

### Built With

[![Bun][Bun]][Bun-url]
[![TypeScript][TypeScript]][TypeScript-url]
[![Svelte][Svelte.dev]][Svelte-url]
[![Tailwind CSS][TailwindCSS]][TailwindCSS-url]
[![shadcn-svelte][shadcn-svelte]][shadcn-svelte-url]
[![Jazz][Jazz]][Jazz-url]

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

<!-- GETTING STARTED -->

## Getting Started

This is an example of how you may give instructions on setting up your project locally.
To get a local copy up and running follow these simple example steps.

### Prerequisites

This project uses [mise-en-place](https://mise.jdx.dev) to manage project-specific dependencies.

1. Follow the official instructions to install `mise`: [Getting Started](https://mise.jdx.dev/getting-started.html)
2. Then, be sure to follow the instructions to [activate `mise`](https://mise.jdx.dev/getting-started.html#activate-mise) for your shell.

### Installation

1. Clone the repo
   ```sh
   git clone https://github.com/azais-corentin/cofund.git
   ```
2. Install dependencies
   ```sh
   bun install
   ```
3. Start the development server
   ```sh
   bun dev
   ```

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

For more details on how to contribute, please see the [contribution guide](docs/issue_guide.md).
